title.$t: ASL Summer Kit - Red Panda ASL Storytelling with Avery Posner

media$title.$t: ASL Summer Kit - Red Panda ASL Storytelling with Avery Posner

media$description.$t:
Please be kind to animals, pets and even animals at the zoo and parks!

Whew....Ever since schools are coming to a close for the summer, thousands of children, young people and teenagers have flocked to our fan page just to participate.  They are soooo cute and even aaaadorable so aahhheemm....we, the staff, at Everyday ASL Productions had a meeting and decided to honor our devotion by uploading a brief video showing Red Panda, happen to be named Bella and Avery Posner, an advocator of animals.  And also we are making an offer a pre-Summer sale for the kids, young people and even adults, too.  So, anyway, please take your plenty time and watch the video.  You can get the ASL Summer Kit offer with free candy and S&H at http://bit.ly/aslsummer.

Have a great and safe ASL summer!
Much love always from Gilda and Avery

And also we are making an offer a pre-Summer sale for the kids, young people and even adults, too.  So, anyway, please take your plenty time and watch the video.  You can get the ASL Summer Kit offer with free candy and S&H at http://bit.ly/aslsummer.

Have a great and safe ASL summer!
Much love always from Gilda and Avery

title.$t: Easter ASL Vocabulary Lesson with EverydayASL.com (50+ words and 15 sentences) FREE

media$title.$t: Easter ASL Vocabulary Lesson with EverydayASL.com (50+ words and 15 sentences) FREE

media$description.$t:
Dear friends, fans and rabbits,
Believe it or not, Easter is right around the corner!  Let's warm up your paws and set your carrots aside and work on over 50 words and 15 sentences in ASL to just communicate in a breeze about the holiday.  You know what? If you guys do well, you should get yourselves a slice of carrot cake instead mmmm.  Anyway, love always...now we are hopping away!!  Happy and safe Easter to you all ❤ Gilda and Avery

Visit http://www.everydayasl.com

title.$t: Valentine's Day ASL Vocabulary Lesson with EverydayASL.com (80+ words, idioms and phrases) FREE

media$title.$t: Valentine's Day ASL Vocabulary Lesson with EverydayASL.com (80+ words, idioms and phrases) FREE

media$description.$t:
Dear everyone,

Wow - it's Valentine's Day already!  Well, we all pulled up our sleeves so we could provide a free ASL tutorial video which comes with few ASL idioms, vocabulary (I think about 80 words) and especially never-seen-before videos of Avery interacting with animals!

Please share the love and have a Happy Valentine's Day!
Always from Gilda and Avery

Visit http://www.everydayasl.com

title.$t: New Year ASL Vocabulary Lesson with EverydayASL.com (150 words, idioms and phrases) FREE

media$title.$t: New Year ASL Vocabulary Lesson with EverydayASL.com (150 words, idioms and phrases) FREE

media$description.$t:
Dear everyone,

During good times and difficult times, we want to take the time to gift you with a 13-minute ASL lesson video about celebrating a new year with over 150 words and some idioms & phrases in American Sign Language.  Let us all conquer 2013 with peace, productivity and love.

Happy New Year from Gilda, Avery and the rest of us at Everyday ASL Productions (throwing recycled confetti)

title.$t: Sign Language Vocabulary about July 4th - Independence Day

media$title.$t: Sign Language Vocabulary about July 4th - Independence Day

media$description.$t:
Ba-boom!  Our July 4th ASL Lesson video tutorial has arrived!  Let us all sit comfortably now and enjoy the free lesson.  Yet, please be safe during the holiday and be considerate of your children, pets and animals when using fireworks.  The noise and lights of fireworks often frighten some animals, and you may want to consider moving them away and/or keeping them inside during your display.

We appreciate you and wish you all a wonderful holiday!!

Learn more about our ASL DVDs at http://www.everydayasl.com

title.$t: Memorial Day - Sign Language Vocabulary and Idiom Lesson

media$title.$t: Memorial Day - Sign Language Vocabulary and Idiom Lesson

media$description.$t:
Dear everyone,

Memorial Day is a day of remembering the women and men who died while serving in the United States Armed Forces.  A moment of remembrance only brings me a step closer to my dad, who was a war veteran of the United States Army.

Learn more free ASL Lesson videos and tutorials at http://bit.ly/freeasl.

We appreciate your support and interest in our hard work.  In the meantime, we all wish you, your family and friends a safe and meaningful Memorial Day holiday.

Love and Peace Forever,
Gilda Toby Ganezer and Avery Posner
Co-Founders
Everyday ASL Productions

title.$t: Tax Refund - ASL Idiom Lesson with EverydayASL.com

media$title.$t: Tax Refund - ASL Idiom Lesson with EverydayASL.com

media$description.$t:
Dear friends and fans,

Taxes...Taxes...We know it is becoming quite a topic for many around this time; so here's a quick ASL lesson on how to sign "TAX REFUND" and "IT'S ABOUT TIME".  Take a little break from organizing these receipts and W-2 forms and sit back to enjoy the free lesson with us at Everyday ASL Productions.

Learn more about our ASL DVDs and products, visit http://www.everydayasl.com and join our fanpage for free ASL lessons and updates at http://on.fb.me/eapfbwelcome.

title.$t: Common Expressions in Sign Language, Vol. 2 - Examples & DVD Preview

media$title.$t: Common Expressions in Sign Language, Vol. 2 - Examples & DVD Preview

media$description.$t:
How do you sign "ARE YOU BUSY", "GOOD IDEA", "THAT'S NONE OF YOUR BUSINESS!", "I NEED TO PRACTICE FINGERSPELLING" and so on in American Sign Language?

Look no further, this DVD is a great way to learn American Sign Language with hundreds of ASL words, sentences, idioms/phrases along with interactive quizzes and ASL Storytelling.

Learn some more free ASL lessons and about our library of ASL DVDs, go to: http://bit.ly/eapfb or http://everydayasl.com.

content.$t:
How do you sign "ARE YOU BUSY", "GOOD IDEA", "THAT'S NONE OF YOUR BUSINESS!", "I NEED TO PRACTICE FINGERSPELLING" and so on in American Sign Language?

Look no further, this DVD is a great way to learn American Sign Language with hundreds of ASL words, sentences, idioms/phrases along with interactive quizzes and ASL Storytelling.

Learn some more free ASL lessons and about our library of ASL DVDs, go to: http://bit.ly/eapfb or http://everydayasl.com.

title.$t: American Sign Language Exercise #2: Build Your ASL IDIOMS & PHRASES Skills Using "Open 8" Handshape

media$title.$t: American Sign Language Exercise #2: Build Your ASL IDIOMS & PHRASES Skills Using "Open 8" Handshape

media$description.$t:
American Sign Language Exercise #2: Build Your ASL IDIOMS & PHRASES skills using the same handshape: "Open 8".

The ASL "Open 8" handshape is where your fingers and thumb are spread with the middle finger bent at the base joint and all other fingers extended.

Look for more free ASL Videos from Everyday ASL Productions at http://www.everydayasl.com and join our Facebook at http://bit.ly/eapfb

content.$t:
American Sign Language Exercise #2: Build Your ASL IDIOMS & PHRASES skills using the same handshape: "Open 8".

The ASL "Open 8" handshape is where your fingers and thumb are spread with the middle finger bent at the base joint and all other fingers extended.

Look for more free ASL Videos from Everyday ASL Productions at http://www.everydayasl.com and join our Facebook at http://bit.ly/eapfb

Courtesy Everyday ASL Productions - visit: http://www.EverydayASL.com

title.$t: American Sign Language Exercise #1: Build Your ASL Vocabulary Skills Using "Open 8" Handshape

media$title.$t: American Sign Language Exercise #1: Build Your ASL Vocabulary Skills Using "Open 8" Handshape

media$description.$t:
American Sign Language Exercise #1: Build Your ASL Vocabulary skills using the same handshape: "Open 8".

The ASL "Open 8" handshape is where your fingers and thumb are spread with the middle finger bent at the base joint and all other fingers extended.

Look for more free ASL Videos from Everyday ASL Productions at http://www.everydayasl.com and join our Facebook at http://bit.ly/eapfb

title.$t: ASL Sentence Structure Contest - Cash & DVD Prizes!

media$title.$t: ASL Sentence Structure Contest - Cash & DVD Prizes!

media$description.$t:
Get in the festive spirit and win during our 1st Annual ASL Sentence Structure Contest.

We're looking for your correct answer.

Go to our Facebook fan page, join as a fan and submit a correct answer to the contest video's as comments and you could win one of 4 prizes!

SUBMIT YOUR ENTRY TO OUR FACEBOOK FANPAGE NOW
VIA http://bit.ly/eapfb

Details:
- Answer(s) must be thoroughly correct.

- Submit your entry directly under the video contest post as a comment on Everyday ASL Productions' fan page at http://bit.ly/eapfb on or before midnight EST time on Friday, December 24.

- Multiple entries may be submitted, but only one prize will be awarded per person.

- Throughout the contest, your answer(s)/comments will be recognized in Everyday ASL Productions' website and Facebook pages. Some entries may receive bonus prizes such as candies!

- Winners of prizes will be randomly drawn/selected, notified and announced on or about Christmas Day.

- 4 Prizes are as follows:

-- One (1) $ 100.00 cash (USD) Grand Prize

-- and 3 individual DVD prizes (DVDs will be handpicked by the staff at Everyday ASL Productions)

- By entering the contest, you give Everyday ASL Productions, Ltd. permission to publish your name, location and entry on the website, e-newsletters and/or Facebook pages.
 
- Winners will need to provide Everyday ASL Productions staff with name and mailing address necessary to receive prize.  Allow up to 3 weeks for delivery.

title.$t: EverydayASL.com supports animals rescued from Hurricane Katrina

media$title.$t: EverydayASL.com supports animals rescued from Hurricane Katrina

media$description.$t:
Five years after Hurricane Katrina's wrath, EverydayASL.com wish to share a video, narrated in ASL by Avery Posner, covering how cats and dogs were affected by Hurricane Katrina five years ago and how North Shore Animal League, http://www.nsal.org/, one of many amazing animal rescue organizations, came to save countless animals who were victims by the tragedy.

Thank you for watching and lending a hand.  Love a lot from Gilda, Avery and the rest of us at EverydayASL.com

Five years after Hurricane Katrina's wrath, EverydayASL.com wish to share a video, narrated in ASL by Avery Posner, covering how cats and dogs were affected by Hurricane Katrina five years ago and how North Shore Animal League, http://www.nsal.org/, one of many amazing animal rescue organizations, came to save countless animals who were victims by the tragedy.

Thank you for watching and lending a hand.  Love a lot from Gilda, Avery and the rest of us at EverydayASL.com

title.$t: ASL Interpretation / Narration - The Christmas Tree at Rockefeller Center - New York City

media$title.$t: ASL Interpretation / Narration - The Christmas Tree at Rockefeller Center - New York City

media$description.$t:
For more free ASL videos, join our Facebook fan page at: http://bit.ly/eapfb

This video is a part of EverydayASL.com's American Sign Language Interpreter Training: Expressive Skills DVD. This video will show Avery Posner doing a complete narration / ASL interpretation about the nearly 100-feet tall Christmas Tree at Rockefeller Center in New York City, both in spoken English, ASL and with open captions, So be sure to enjoy the narration; which is an excerpt from the ASL interpreter training DVD.

Notice the bloopers at the end of that video?  Look for Gilda Ganezer, our co-founder and actress/co-director, share hilarious bloopers along with April Starks, who is an ASL interpreter/professor.  Well, as teachers and human beings ourselves, we all experience blunders while interpreting and/or narrating. Its a trial and error that helps one master the use of language!

For more information on the DVD, you are welcome to visit:

http://www.everydayasl.com and look under ASL Interpreter Training category down the webpage.

content.$t:
For more free ASL videos, join our Facebook fan page at: http://bit.ly/eapfb

Notice the bloopers at the end of that video?  Look for Gilda Ganezer, our co-founder and actress/co-director, share hilarious bloopers along with April Starks, who is an ASL interpreter/professor.  Well, as teachers and human beings ourselves, we all experience blunders while interpreting and/or narrating. Its a trial and error that helps one master the use of language!

title.$t: American Sign Language Interpreter Training DVD - Receptive Skills Practice at EverydayASL.com

media$title.$t: American Sign Language Interpreter Training DVD - Receptive Skills Practice at EverydayASL.com

media$description.$t:
For more free ASL videos, join our Facebook fan page at: http://bit.ly/eapfb


New ASL Interpreter training DVD:

"American Sign Language Interpreter Training: Receptive Skills Practice, Vol. 1" DVD Preview.

You can order your first ASL interpreter training DVD at:

http://everydayasl.com/product227696.htm

or at Amazon.com:

http://www.amazon.com/dp/B002HMDEDE/

Details:

Being an ASL interpreter is a labor of love. There are a number of steps and processes that every interpreter needs to use each and every time he or she interprets. One of the fundamental abilities that an interpreter must develop in order to work closely and efficiently with Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing consumers is the maintenance and bolstering of receptive skills.

Throughout the video, there will be 5 chapters containing ASL Storytelling where Avery Posner will be teaching about several animals in the Central Park Zoo as well as a dramatic story about a successful animal rescue operation. In every chapter, viewers will first see a complete story without audio or captions. Immediately following the story, there will be over 50 training questions four main activities to aid interpreters and ASL students to develop receptive skills:

- Fingerspelling Check
- Fact Check
- Idiom & Phrase Check
- Sign-to-Voice Check

As a bonus, you will learn seven additional commonly used idioms and phrases in American Sign Language. Gilda Ganezer and Avery Posner will present the idioms and then show you how to use them in complete sentences.

An ASL Music video along with series of bloopers will be included, also as a bonus feature!


Cast:
Gilda Ganezer & Avery Posner

Learn more about the DVD, go to:

http://www.everydayasl.com

Details:
